comments.author: Alois Kraus
comments.message: A C# console applicaion template with a more functional command line parser is also on Code Gallery: http://visualstudiogallery....

comments.author: Terrance Smith
comments.message:
Dude, I am way impressed. F# and C are both languages I slowly am attempting to achieve some sort of mastery over so already relevant to my interests.
But then you did a F#->glib & C parser.
You just won the game.
I am curious about your other projects as well including your C lib https://github.com/lucabol/.... Are you going to add licensing to your stuff or just have it out there?

replies.author: lucabol
replies.message: LLib has the most liberal license I could find (BSD) and it just uses BSD components. All the rest is just out there. Use whatever you need.

comments.author: John Martin
comments.message: I have a problem is is driving me crazy and I'm not sure how to post a question. It is regarding passing a pointer (int *Pointer;) to a function, having that function assign the pointer with malloc, then, when the function ends and I'm back in main, it destroys the pointer.

replies.author: lucabol
replies.message: This looks like something to post on stackoverflow with a suitable repro case. Cheers.
